text: so replacement effects can only replace the same instance once
so in al archive + collector you each get a card
no loop
which replaces first
als or alms
al archive player draws 1 card or 2 cards?
apnap
so say
you control archive (Ar) and I control Alms (Al) and you draw any SINGLE card
ooh i see which ever one causes the replacement first
because one replaces because of the other one happening i guess
Ar goes off then Al replaces that
yeah, poretty sure
k that makes sense
but say you draw multiple cards,
then I THINK
what happens
put effets in stack APNAP
Al doubles under Ar replace
ar replaces, then al doubles that
since you can'
can't replace the same effect w/ a replacement effect again
it leaves it there
I THINK
i agree w/ it
:smile:
thanks

616.1. If two or more replacement and/or prevention effects are attempting to modify the way an event affects an object or player, the affected object’s controller (or its owner if it has no controller) or the affected player chooses one to apply, following the steps listed below. If two or more players have to make these choices at the same time, choices are made in APNAP order (see rule 101.4).
they arent modifying the same thing though
they're modifying each other
this would be like rebound and RIP
well
they may be in the case of drawing more than one card at a time
They are modifying the same thing - the draw a card event, aren't they?
ummm yes, but not at the same time...
right
nope idk
maybe you're right and you just get to pick, which seems silly to me, but I guess that solves this problem

I was just in there lol
IF the Archive player attempts to draw a single card, that won't 'trigger' Alm's effect until after Archive's replacement effect. The effect is both draw 1.
and I was right :stuck_out_tongue:
except not totally
If they attempt to draw more than one, then the active player chooss.
chooses.
chooses which to apply first
so if they pick archive first
they get 1 and 1
but they can pick alms first
and get 2 and 1
cause theirs is doubled by archive
Right - in the case of initially attempting to draw 2 or more cards.
